solution_line_template: First find the total number of baby minks: {adult_minks} minks * {babies_per_mink} babies/mink = <<{adult_minks}*{babies_per_mink}={total_baby_minks}>>{total_baby_minks} minks
Add this to the number of adult minks: {total_baby_minks} minks + {adult_minks} minks = <<{total_baby_minks}+{adult_minks}={total_minks}>>{total_minks} minks
Then divide this number in half to find how many aren't set free: {total_minks} minks / {freed_divisor} = <<{total_minks}/{freed_divisor}={remaining_minks}>>{remaining_minks} minks

Then divide the remaining number of minks by the number of minks per coat to find the number of coats: {remaining_minks} minks / {minks_per_coat} minks/coat = <<{remaining_minks}/{minks_per_coat}={coats}>>{coats} coats
